frame.name: Hostile_encounter
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame consists of words that describe a hostile encounter between opposing forces (<fen>Side_1</fen> and <fen>Side_2</fen>, collectively conceptualizable as <fen>Sides</fen>) over a disputed <fen>Issue</fen> and/or in order to reach a specific <fen>Purpose</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Side_1">He</fex> still wants to <t>fight</t> <fex name="Side_2">Mike Tyson</fex> <fex name="Time">in about 8 months</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Side_1">Dennis Andries's</fex> <fex name="Purpose">European cruiserweight title</fex> <t>clash</t> <fex name="Side_2">against Akim Tafer of France</fex> <fex name="Place">in Beausoleil</fex> <fex name="Time">last February</fex> has been voted as the EBU's fight of the year.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Side_1
FE.definition: <def-root>One of two participants in a hostile encounter. <ex>While <fex name="Side_1">the U.S.'s</fex> <t>battle</t> with terrorist-harboring nations is far off ...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Side_2
FE.definition: <def-root>One of two participants in a hostile encounter, usually the second mentioned. <ex>While the U.S.'s <t>battle</t> <fex name="Side_2">with terrorist-harboring nations</fex> is far off ...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Sides
FE.definition: <def-root>The jointly expressed sides in a hostile encounter. <ex><fex name="Sides">They</fex> <t>fought</t> over the right to own land.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Issue
FE.definition:
<def-root>An unresolved question over which the two sides of a hostile encounter are in disagreement.
<ex>They had a <t>dust-up</t> <fex name="Issue">over who was prettier</fex> .</ex>
Quite often it takes the form of a covert question of various sorts. So in an example like:
<ex>They <t>fought</t> <fex name="Issue">over the right to own land</fex>.</ex>
among many other possibilities, the covert question might be more explicitly phrased as follows:
<ex>They <t>fought</t> <fex name="Issue">over what the right to own land means</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The desired result of the outcome of the hostile encounter for the <fen>Side_1</fen> or for all the <fen>Sides</fen> collectively. It may either directly refer to the state of affairs that is desired, e.g.
<ex>He <t>dueled</t> with his former second <fex name="Purpose">to defend the honour of the man he had killed</fex> .</ex>
or it the state of affairs may be implicit in an (abstract or concrete) entity that they desire, e.g.
<ex>Rival Democratic presidential candidates Mr Bill Clinton and Mr Jerry Brown taunted each other at the weekend as mudslinging in the <t>battle</t> <fex name="Purpose">for votes</fex> in tomorrow's crucial New York primary reached a new low.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root><fex name="Mns">Means</fex> describes the way in which a side engages in a hostile encounter. <ex>President Corazon Aquino of the Philippines is bracing herself for a <fex name="Means">legal</fex> <t>battle</t> over her decision to allow the remains of the former president, Ferdinand Marcos, to be returned home from Hawaii for burial.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any expression which describes a property of the hostile encounter. Descriptions of the intensity count as <fex name="Manr">Manner</fex> expressions. <ex>After Brundle's Jaguar took off like a scalded cat, it was Mass who hunted it down, an soon engaged it in a <fex name="Manner">lurid</fex> <t>battle</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the hostile encounter takes place.
<ex>Following the <t>battle</t> <fex name="Place">of Naseby</fex> in 1645 ...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fex name="Time">Time</fex> at which the hostile encounter occurs.
<ex>Following the <t>battle</t> of Naseby <fex name="Time">in 1645</fex> he died.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Degr">Degree</fex> to which an event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>A <fex name="Dep">Depictive</fex> phrase describing the actor of an action.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> for which an event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Ins">Instrument</fex> with which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The body movement may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an <fex name="ICause">Internal Cause</fex>, the Agent's mental or emotional state. Internal Cause is expressed in a PP complement.</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: schermutseling.n
lexUnit.definition: in de vorm van een woordenwisseling of klein handgemeen
